response.answer_text: Not restricting my list to technologies so will mention niches too, a simple Google would help you know the technology required for them. I strongly suggest you find your interests and then choose a niche or technology. Choosing simply basis money or some market research prediction is naive, I am afraid like many you would eventually lose interest Here you go. Azure cloud developerDBAWeb developer (might not look very lucrative but freelance opportunities are endless)AIMachine learningBlock chainBig data, Hadoop, R , python (the obvious ones that come under IoT )Angular and reactAugmented and virtual realityCloud computingRobotics Process automationCyber security (this one is going to trend for long considering the investments businesses are doing after what happened with FB, Quora etc. )Hope this helps.

In the field of IT none of the Technologies can sustain for a prolonged period. Every new technology or language have a golden period after which it goes and something else replaces it. As far Technology is concerned I would consider Java to be the best one compared to others as it have been there in the industry for a long time. Also the current scenario of IT is that its moving towards automation and BPM Tools such as PEGA and Appian are in good demand for automating the business process. These tools are made out of java and hence I consider learning java to the best will be a plus...At last try to learn any technology at its best... It will benefit you...
